content: Ship company in Singapore **OMC Shipping pte. ltd.**, also known as **OMCS**, is a [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) based [ship owning](/wiki/Ship-owner) company. It is the ship owning arm of [Mitsui & Co.](/wiki/Mitsui_%26_Co.), one of the largest [trading companies *(sogo sosha)* of Japan](/wiki/Sogo_shosha). ## Fleet OMC owns, operates and manages a fleet of 19 ships. This includes [bulk carriers](/wiki/Bulk_carrier) (handy size to cape size), [oil tankers](/wiki/Oil_tankers) (product and crude oil), [car carriers](/wiki/Pure_car_carrier) (PCTC of size 8000 CEU) and [container ships](/wiki/Container_ships) (up to 9700 TEU in size). The company also charters these ships out on time charters and voyage charters. The company also owns and operates additional ships on short and [long-term charters](/wiki/Time_Charter). This [Singaporean corporation or company](/wiki/List_of_companies_of_Singapore) article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: OMC Shipping
